summary: Website project: create a Valentine’s gift website for the user’s wife.
known_issues: Uploaded user photos are not displaying on the website after upload (gallery not rendering user-provided images).

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine’s gift website that the user can share as a present for their wife, with English user-facing copy and a romantic, heartfelt tone.

Implement a coherent visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) with an elegant romantic style using warm tones (e.g., rose/cream/gold) and consistent styling across all sections (avoid blue/purple).

Add the following sections to the single-page website with smooth in-page navigation: (1) Hero section with a Valentine headline and short dedication, (2) “Love Letter” section (multi-paragraph), (3) “Reasons I Love You” list, (4) “Our Story” timeline (3–6 milestones), (5) Photo gallery section with 6 placeholder image slots and captions, (6) Closing section with a signature line and call-to-action button (e.g., “Open Your Surprise”).

Provide a simple personalization UI that lets the user edit key content fields (e.g., wife’s name, sender name, Valentine year/date, love letter text, reasons list items, and timeline entries) and persist changes locally in the browser (e.g., localStorage).

Add tasteful lightweight micro-interactions suitable for a Valentine gift page: subtle fade/slide-in section transitions on scroll, and a small celebratory heart/confetti animation when the final call-to-action is clicked (with a setting to disable animations for accessibility).
Add required static image assets to the frontend and render them in the UI from the static assets directory (no backend image serving).
Add support for user-provided gallery photos so the Valentine page photo gallery can be populated with a few personal images (up to 6), without requiring any backend storage.
Extend the Personalize dialog UI to let the user add/replace/remove up to 6 photos for the gallery using a local file picker, and persist the selected photos locally in the browser.
Update the Gallery section to render user-provided photos when available and fall back to the existing static placeholder images when not.
Handle personalization storage versioning/compatibility so existing users with saved personalization data do not experience runtime errors after adding the new gallery photo fields.
Ensure user-uploaded gallery photos appear on the Valentine page gallery immediately after upload and persist correctly across refreshes.

Fix personalization dialog state synchronization so the Photos tab edits (uploads/removals) are applied to the saved personalization state reliably, and the dialog always reflects the current saved content when opened.
Add user-facing error handling when photo persistence fails (e.g., localStorage quota exceeded), and prevent showing a success message when persistence fails.
Implement client-side image size reduction for uploaded gallery photos before storing them locally to improve reliability of persistence in localStorage.
